{{sources}} {{Noble House infobox | name=House of Telcontar | image = Rondador - House of Telcontar.png | caption=Emblem of the house by Rondador | othernames= | founder=[[Aragorn|Elessar]] | location=[[Reunited Kingdom]] | affiliation= | rivalry= | destroyed= | language=[[Westron]] | members=[[Aragorn]], [[Eldarion]] | race=[[Dúnedain]] | distinctions= | height= | hair= | skin= | clothing= | weapons=[[Andúril]] | heirlooms=[[Crown of Gondor]], [[Elendilmir]], [[Elfstone]], [[Ring of Barahir]],Nothing is said of the fate of the ring in the [[Fourth Age]], but unless it went with [[Arwen]] to her grave at [[Cerin Amroth]], it most likely passed to the Kings of the [[Reunited Kingdom]], descendants of Aragorn and Arwen. [[Sceptre of Annúminas]] | gallery=the House of Telcontar }} The '''House of Telcontar''' was the Royal House of the [[Reunited Kingdom]] of [[Arnor]] and [[Gondor]] in the [[Fourth Age]]. The House was founded by [[Aragorn|Aragorn II]] after the [[War of the Ring]], who was the Heir of Elendil, and took the throne under the name Elessar. == History == During the War of the Ring, [[Peregrin Took]], a companion of Aragorn's in the [[Fellowship of the Ring]], became a member of the elite Citadel Guard at [[Minas Tirith]], capital of Gondor. When Aragorn entered the city, Peregrin persisted in crudely referring to Aragorn by the nickname he had garnered as a Ranger of the North: "Strider", even in front of foreign dignitaries such as King [[Éomer]] of [[Rohan]]. Aragorn was amused and decided that the name of the lineage he founded would be "Telcontar", which means "Strider" in Quenya. Aragorn then took the royal name "Elessar".{{RK|Houses}}, p. 863 With Queen [[Arwen]], King Elessar Telcontar reigned for 120 years, before finally surrendering his life. This long reign is attributed to Elessar's descent from the Men of [[Númenor]], who are blessed with long life (he was 87 when he took the throne). He rebuilt the old capital [[Annúminas]] in Arnor and later ruled from this northern capital, although the old capital Minas Tirith was still of great political importance. Elessar had one known son, [[Eldarion]], and an unspecified number of daughters. After Aragorn's death in {{FoA|120}},{{App|Tale}} his son [[Eldarion]] took up the High Kingship. One hundred years into his reign, he encountered a [[The New Shadow|new threat]], known only as the "[[Dark Tree]]".{{PM|Shadow}} Of Eldarion, it was foretold that he should rule a great realm, and that it should endure for a hundred generations of [[Men]] after him, that is until a new age brought in again new things; and from him should come the kings of many realms in long days after. But if this foretelling spoke truly, none now can say, for [[Gondor]] and [[Arnor]] are no more; and even the chronicles of the House of Telcontar and all their deeds and glory are lost.{{PM|Third}}, text of manuscript T4 events after the end of the Third Age in the year 3021 == Etymology == The name ''Telcontar'' (pron. {{IPA|[telˈkontar]}}) was a translation into [[Quenya]] of Aragorn's common nickname in the north, "[[Strider (Aragorn)|Strider]]". == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | ARA |y| ARW |ARA='''[[Aragorn|Elessar]]'''
